cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Savannah, Georgia
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northward, then expected to turn NNE–NE hugging the Georgia and South Carolina coasts toward southern North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the South Carolina coast (around Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Surf City, NC to Cape Lookout, NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning north of Fernandina Beach, FL to Surf City, NC; Tropical Storm Warning north of Surf City, NC to Duck, NC and north of Flagler/Volusia county line, FL to Fernandina Beach, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida through Georgia, South Carolina and southern North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with occasional hurricane-force gusts affected the port on 7 Oct; conditions easing overnight.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation and large battering waves possible but peak surge zone lies north of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands produced heavy rain totals exceeding 4 inches in places; additional amounts generally under 1 inch expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; brief tornado threat now shifting north.
